snippet: Bus operators in Honduras say they are noticing a decline in the number of unaccompanied children headed to the border, and the Border Patrol has reported a dip in the number of people apprehended in Texas.
abstract: Bus operators in Honduras notice a decline in the number of unaccompanied children headed to United States border, and US Border Patrol reports a dip in the number of people apprehended in Texas; it is too soon to say definitively whether mass migration of Central American children has relented, but officials are hopeful that it may be slowing as new efforts by authorities to stop the flow take root.

byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from McAllen, Tex.

lead_paragraph: Bus operators in Honduras say they are noticing a decline in the number of unaccompanied children headed to the border, and the Border Patrol has reported a dip in the number of people apprehended in Texas.

headline.main: Trying to Slow the Illegal Flow of Young Migrants
headline.print_headline: Trying to Slow the Illegal Flow of Young Migrants
